description: Stakes escalation and pressure-building rules governing tension progression, consequences, and urgency in detective narratives
stakes_philosophy: Reader investment requires meaningful consequences. Stakes must be personal, escalating, and tangible. Abstract stakes ('justice must prevail') are weak; specific stakes ('partner will die if case not solved by midnight') create urgency.

stakes_categories.professional: Career consequences, department politics, case closure pressure
stakes_categories.moral: Innocent people at risk, justice vs. expedience decisions
stakes_categories.physical: Life-or-death danger to detective or others

stakes_establishment.description: Stakes must be clearly defined and matter to characters

validations.name: concrete-stakes-definition
validations.description: Stakes must be specific and tangible, not abstract; reader must understand exactly what's at risk

examples.violation: 'The detective needed to solve the case' (why? what happens if they don't?)
examples.compliant: 'Three victims in three weeks. If she didn't catch this killer before the next full moon, there'd be a fourth.' (specific consequences: another death, time pressure)

validations.validation_query: What exactly will happen if the protagonist fails? Is it specific and tangible?

validations.name: personal-investment
validations.description: Stakes must matter personally to detective, not just professionally

examples.violation: Detective has no personal connection; just another case
examples.compliant: Victim reminds detective of their sister; or case threatens partner; or failure could end career after captain's warning

validations.validation_query: Why does this case matter personally to the detective beyond professional duty?

validations.name: multiple-stake-layers
validations.description: Combine professional, personal, and moral stakes for maximum investment

examples.violation: Only professional stakes: solve case or face captain's disapproval
examples.compliant: Professional: case closure pressure. Personal: partner is suspect's next target. Moral: innocent person in jail for crime they didn't commit.

validations.validation_query: How many types of stakes are active? Are they layered for complexity?

stakes_escalation.description: Stakes must increase throughout story; never de-escalate until resolution

validations.name: progressive-raising
validations.description: Each act must have higher stakes than previous; each major scene should add pressure

examples.violation: Act 2 threat level same or lower than Act 1
examples.compliant: Act 1: property crime → Act 2: assault, pattern suggests escalation → Act 3: serial murders, detective personally targeted

validations.validation_query: Are current stakes higher than they were 5 chapters ago? Than at story start?

validations.name: midpoint-stakes-raise
validations.description: Story midpoint should significantly raise stakes through revelation or complication

examples.violation: Midpoint revelation doesn't change threat level or urgency
examples.compliant: Midpoint: discovered 'isolated murder' is actually serial killer; threat level jumps from single case to ongoing danger

validations.validation_query: How does the midpoint raise stakes? What new pressure is added?

validations.name: act-2-complication-progression
validations.description: Act 2 should feature 3-5 major complications, each worse than the last

examples.violation: Obstacles appear but don't increase in severity
examples.compliant: Complication 1: witness refuses to talk → 2: evidence contaminated → 3: captain threatens to close case → 4: partner suspended → 5: killer targets detective's family

validations.validation_query: List Act 2 complications. Does each raise stakes above the previous?

time_pressure.description: Ticking clocks create urgency and force action

validations.name: deadline-introduction
validations.description: Introduce time pressure by end of Act 1 or early Act 2 at latest

examples.violation: No time constraints until final chapter; detective can investigate indefinitely
examples.compliant: Act 1: pattern suggests killer strikes every 72 hours. Act 2: countdown to next predicted murder creates urgency.

validations.validation_query: What time constraints exist? When were they established?

validations.name: deadline-tightening
validations.description: Time pressure should increase; introduce additional deadlines or accelerate existing ones

examples.violation: Same deadline throughout; no increasing urgency
examples.compliant: Initial deadline: 1 week to solve case. Midpoint: killer accelerates schedule to 48 hours. Act 3: race against 6-hour countdown.

validations.validation_query: Has time pressure increased from when first introduced?

validations.name: realistic-time-constraints
validations.description: Deadlines must be justified by plot logic, not arbitrary authorial imposition

examples.violation: Captain gives detective 24 hours to solve case for no clear reason
examples.compliant: Evidence suggests killer will strike again at next full moon (3 days); or political pressure from mayor's office demands results before press conference (48 hours)

validations.validation_query: What in-story logic justifies this deadline? Why this timeframe specifically?

threat_escalation.description: Danger level must increase as story progresses

validations.name: personal-danger-progression
validations.description: Threat should move from abstract to personal; detective becomes target

examples.violation: Detective investigates safely throughout; no personal risk
examples.compliant: Act 1: detective investigates crime. Act 2: killer knows detective is investigating. Act 3: detective receives direct threats, loved ones endangered.

validations.validation_query: How has the threat to the detective personally escalated?

validations.name: expanding-victim-pool
validations.description: In serial cases, victim count or threat scope should expand

examples.violation: Single victim throughout; no escalating danger
examples.compliant: First victim → second victim establishes pattern → third victim shows escalation → detective realizes anyone matching profile is at risk

validations.validation_query: How has the scope of danger expanded from story opening?

validations.name: antagonist-capability-demonstration
validations.description: Regularly demonstrate antagonist's power/danger to maintain threat credibility

examples.violation: Villain is described as dangerous but never shown being effective
examples.compliant: Antagonist evades police surveillance, outsmarts detective's trap, eliminates witness, demonstrating continued capability

validations.validation_query: When was antagonist's competence/danger last demonstrated on-page?

consequence_delivery.description: Threatened consequences must actually occur; empty threats destroy tension

validations.name: follow-through-ratio
validations.description: At least 60-70% of threatened consequences must occur or nearly occur; avoid crying wolf

examples.violation: Every threatened death is prevented; reader stops believing stakes are real
examples.compliant: Threats: 1) witness might die (happens), 2) partner in danger (barely saved), 3) case might be closed (prevented), 4) suspect might escape (happens). Mix of realized and prevented consequences.

validations.validation_query: How many threatened consequences have actually occurred vs. been prevented?

validations.name: cost-of-victory
validations.description: Success should come at a cost; perfect victories reduce stakes credibility

examples.violation: Detective solves case with no personal or professional costs
examples.compliant: Case solved BUT: partner seriously injured, detective's relationship damaged, career advancement opportunity lost, or detective forced to compromise principles

validations.validation_query: What does the detective sacrifice or lose in achieving their goal?

validations.name: permanent-consequences
validations.description: Some consequences should be permanent, not easily reversed

examples.violation: All damage undone by story end; status quo fully restored
examples.compliant: Detective wins but: witness is dead (permanent), partner transfers (lasting change), or detective's worldview fundamentally altered

validations.validation_query: What changes from this case cannot be undone?

emotional_pressure.description: Psychological and emotional toll must be tracked and shown

validations.name: cumulative-stress-impact
validations.description: Investigation stress should accumulate and affect detective's performance/wellbeing

examples.violation: Detective experiences trauma and stress but shows no effects
examples.compliant: Exhaustion from 72-hour investigation affects judgment; witnessing violent crime scenes causes nightmares; pressure from captain creates tension with partner

validations.validation_query: How is the cumulative stress of this investigation affecting the detective?

validations.name: moral-dilemma-pressure
validations.description: Force detective to make difficult choices between competing values

examples.violation: All decisions are clear-cut right vs. wrong
examples.compliant: Detective must choose: break rules to save innocent life, or follow procedure and risk victim's death; sacrifice personal relationship for case, or compromise investigation

validations.validation_query: What impossible choices has the detective faced? What did they sacrifice?

procedural_specific_stakes.description: Detective procedurals have specific professional pressures

validations.name: departmental-pressure
validations.description: Include pressure from department politics, captain, or institutional constraints

examples.violation: Detective operates in vacuum with no institutional oversight or pressure
examples.compliant: Captain demands results before media circus; internal affairs investigating detective's methods; department politics threaten case resources

validations.validation_query: What institutional pressures complicate the investigation?

validations.name: procedural-vs-results-tension
validations.description: Create tension between doing things correctly and getting results quickly

examples.violation: Detective never faces choice between proper procedure and expediency
examples.compliant: Warrant will take 24 hours but suspect might flee; or pressure to arrest obvious suspect vs. waiting for conclusive evidence

validations.validation_query: When has proper procedure conflicted with urgent need for results?

validations.name: partner-stakes
validations.description: Use partner relationship as source of emotional stakes and pressure

examples.violation: Partner is background presence with no stake-raising role
examples.compliant: Partner disagrees with detective's theory, creating tension; or partner endangered by investigation; or partner's trust must be earned after previous betrayal

validations.validation_query: How does the partnership dynamic create pressure or raise stakes?

magical_stakes_escalation.description: Urban fantasy allows unique stake-raising through magical consequences

validations.name: magical-cost-accumulation
validations.description: If magic has costs, they should accumulate and create pressure

examples.violation: Detective uses magic freely with no accumulating consequences
examples.compliant: Each spell drains detective; accumulated magical exhaustion becomes liability; or magical debt to powerful entity comes due

validations.validation_query: Are magical costs accumulating to create pressure?

validations.name: supernatural-threat-escalation
validations.description: Magical antagonists can escalate threat in ways mundane criminals cannot

examples.violation: Magical antagonist uses same tactics as non-magical criminal
examples.compliant: Antagonist: starts with subtle magic (disguise, influence) → escalates to overt supernatural attacks (curses, summonings) → final confrontation threatens reality-warping consequences

validations.validation_query: How does magical capability escalate threat beyond mundane danger?

agent_integration.edna: Primary validator for stakes escalation and pacing tension
agent_integration.miranda: Track stakes progression across story arc; ensure proper escalation
agent_integration.bailey: Monitor pressure building during scene drafting
agent_integration.dr_viktor: Validate emotional consequences and psychological toll authenticity
